body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello, thank you for contacting our customer support. My name is Matthew Brown, and I am from Safe Motors. May I have your name, please?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Melissa. In order to assist you better, could you please provide me with the last four digits of your phone number?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Of course, it's two three four five.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Great, thank you. Now, could you tell me the first three digits of your home address?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Melissa. We have noted your information and will assist you with your privacy-related concern regarding Safe Motors. Is there anything specific you would like to address today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I just wanted to inquire about the privacy policies at Safe Motors, thank you.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for sharing your concern, Melissa. We take privacy seriously and will ensure your information is protected. If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to ask. Thank you for your time today.

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Thank you. I appreciate your assistance.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: You're welcome. Have a great day, Melissa. Goodbye.
